Nineteen years following the attacks on September 11, 2001, the Placentia-Yorba Linda Unified School District (PYLUSD) joins the nation in remembering the thousands of Americans who lost their lives, including the brave first responders.

Every year on September 11, known as Patriot Day, PYLUSD facilities fly flags at half-staff and all schools hold special ceremonies, activities, or moments of silence in remembrance. This year, due to the unprecedented nature of the COVID-19 pandemic and ongoing campus closures, the district created this video for students, families, staff, and community members to view in remembrance.

This video was created by Valencia High School's (VHS) Tiger Tube program under the direction of teacher, Rod Boaz. It is narrated by VHS senior, Ricky Lopez.

#PYLUSD will never forget.

PYLUSD will never forget.
